title: Ronnie O'Sullivan rates Mark Selby's English Open win very highly
text:
Mark Selby was in stunning form to win the English Open (Picture: VCG via Getty Images)

Ronnie O’Sullivan believes Mark Selby might have already produced the best performance of the entire season in his 9-1 demolition of David Gilbert in the English Open final.

The 36-year-old was in fabulous form as he rattled in two centuries and six half-centuries en route to the one-sided victory in Crawley.

The three-time world champion had been going through something of a barren spell by his standards, last lifting a trophy at the China Championship in September 2018.

However, he was back to his best on Sunday as he dispatched Gilbert with relative ease to claim the £70,000 top prize and the first title of this year’s Home Nations series.

‘I don’t think you’ll see a better performance than that all season,’ O’Sullivan said on Eurosport. ‘Someone will have to play an unbelievable game of snooker to better that.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘He scored heavy, brilliant safety it was clinical. The one frame Gilbert won he scored a century. It was tough stuff.’

The Rocket was right in his analysis, the Angry Farmer was 5-0 behind before he rolled in a break of 101, in what turned out to be his only frame of the match.

Selby was thrilled with his performance and to get back to winning ways after a run of form that he was struggling to deal with.

The Jester from Leicester said after his first round win in Crawley on Monday: ‘I won five tournaments one year, then anything less than that it seems like a failure which is obviously not the case because it’s tough to win any tournament nowadays.

‘Even if I was to lose in the final and it’s still not good enough because of what I’ve achieved in the game and when you’ve set your standards so high. Until I win another tournament my confidence probably won’t come back.’

Now it seems that his confidence will return, as he says he could not have asked for more from his week at the K2 Leisure Centre.

‘Especially in a final,’ said Selby. ‘In any match if you play like that it’s a good performance, but in a final against a class player like Dave, I can’t really ask for much more than that.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Selby and O’Sullivan will be back in action at the World Open in Yushan later this month.
